*div1 type="summary"* *p*Thomas Corwin to Ira Lewis, April 7, 1827. Collection of debt.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Lebanon */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="04-07-1827">7th Ap1 1827.*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir*/p*,
*p*I have been employed by the *person_mentioned*Administrators of Tobias*/person_mentioned* ... to collect the debts of that *person_mentioned*estate*/person_mentioned*, amongst others I find a due bill against you for $150— with about 4 years interest due thereon. My *person_mentioned*clients */person_mentioned*have requested that I should forward the note to some person *location_mentioned*in your neighborhood*/location_mentioned*, but as I knew yourself and no one else in that *location_mentioned*quarter*/location_mentioned*, I thought due to old acquaintance to let you know the claim was in my hands. If you will forward a draft to me or any person in . . . [illegible] with a request to some friend there to receive the note and pay the amot I will deliver the note to such *person_mentioned*person */person_mentioned*[upon re]ceiving the money — The *person_mentioned*Admrs */person_mentioned*[want] to settle soon and th[is is] the only claim not in suit — please to favor me with a reply by return of mail — How stands matters in your *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*in a professional way — Do you make fortunes at pleasure or are you languishing as we are here in the debts of humility Are you really all *person_mentioned*Jacksonians */person_mentioned*or not let me hear from you in regard to these matters.*/p* *p**person_mentioned*Thos. Corwin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Ira Lewis Esq*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Natches Mississippi*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Ira Lewis Esq Attorney*/person_mentioned* at law *location_mentioned*Natchez Missisippi*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
